meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a sharp blow.
meanings.sent1: He thwacked the ball with his bat.
meanings.sent2: She thwacked the table to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The chef thwacked the dough to make the perfect pizza crust.
meanings.sent4: The thunder thwacked the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The hammer thwacked the nail into the wood with a loud sound.

meanings.sent1: The thwack of the hammer echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: He felt the thwack of the ball against his palm.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected thwack on his shoulder made him jump.
meanings.sent4: The thwack of the gavel signaled the end of the trial.
meanings.sent5: The thwack of the whip made the horse gallop faster.
